stimulusHtml: Which of the following most accurately compares the changes shown in Bulgaria with changes in Western Europe during the same period?

features.html:
CONSUMER DURABLES IN COMMUNIST BULGARIA PER 100 HOUSEHOLDS: 1965 AND 1983

19651983
Radios5992
Televisions887
Electric washing machines2381
Refrigerators588
Private cars234
Source: Adapted from Kristen Ghodsee, “Red Nostalgia? Communism, Women’s Emancipation, and Economic Transformation in Bulgaria,” European Journal of Feminist History, 2004. http://scholar.harvard.edu/files/kristenghodsee/files/lhomme-1-2004-ghodsee.pdf

choicesHtml: Growth in the availability of consumer goods in Western Europe was significantly behind that of Bulgaria.
Growth in the availability of consumer goods in Western Europe was similar to that of Bulgaria, but it started from a higher level.
Growth in the availability of consumer goods in Western Europe was stagnant during this period compared to that of Bulgaria.
Consumer goods became less available in Western Europe, compared to Bulgaria, as people in Western Europe began to question the materialistic values of consumer culture.
